thread.title: Crystal Ball: UGA grabs early lead for speedy ATH
thread.title_full: Crystal Ball: UGA grabs early lead for speedy ATH

title: Crystal Ball: UGA grabs early lead for speedy ATH
text:
Manage Crystal Ball: UGA grabs early lead for speedy ATH Georgia has grabbed an early lead for one of the fastest, most talented prospects in the Peach State. Slot to Georgia Links 
Georgia is looking to stack another elite recruiting class on the one it signed in 2017 and in order to make that happen, it'll have to land speedy athletes like Peach County's Kearis Jackson . At 6-feet, 197 pounds Jackson already holds 16 offers with schools like Alabama, Auburn, Florida, Florida State, and Michigan in hot pursuit. 
But there's good news for the UGA faithful. According to the 247Sports Crystal Ball, the Bulldogs grabbed an early lead in the four-star prospects recruitment. UGA has all six predictions for Jackson thus far with four coming since January 12. Not a member? For a limited time, buy one month of Dawgs247 VIP, get two months FREE! 
Jackson could project on offense or defense at the next level. His combination of size and speed make him an interesting option at receiver but programs also like the Ft. Valley native as a defensive back. 
Ranked as the 165th overall prospect and as the No. 9 safety in America by the industry-generated 247Sports Composite, Jackson is more highly thought of by 247Sports than the rest of the industry. According to 247Sports in-house rankings, Jackson is the 78th overall prospect and the fourth athlete in the nation. He's also the 10th overall player in Georgia. 
(What's next for the Bulldogs? Make sure you're in the loop -- take a few moments to sign up for our FREE Bulldogs Newsletter! ) Author
